Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through, and the coating is golden brown and crispy.

Step 10: Remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Step 11: Cheddar Chicken Bites can be served as a delicious appetizer with your favorite dipping sauce or as a tasty addition to a salad.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
• 1 cup spinach, chopped
• 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 teaspoon dried oregano
• 1 teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• Toothpicks or kitchen twine for securing

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: In a bowl, combine crumbled feta cheese, chopped spinach, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, minced garlic, olive oil, dried oregano, dried thyme, and lemon juice. Mix well.

Step 4: Make a pocket in each chicken breast by cutting a slit horizontally through the side, being careful not to cut all the way through.

Step 5: Stuff each chicken breast with the feta mixture, then secure the openings with toothpicks or tie with kitchen twine.

Step 6: Season the outside of the chicken breasts with a bit more salt and black pepper.

Step 7: In an oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.

Step 8: Sear the stuffed chicken breasts on each side until golden brown.

Step 9: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 10: Remove from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Step 11: Feta Stuffed Chicken is often served with a side of roasted vegetables, quinoa, or a fresh salad.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 large eggs
• 2 cups breadcrumbs (preferably Italian-style)
• 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 2 cups marinara sauce
• 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
• Fresh basil or parsley for garnish
• Olive oil for frying

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: Set up a breading station: Place the flour in one shallow dish, beat the eggs in another dish, and mix the breadcrumbs with grated Parmesan cheese in a third dish.

Step 4: Dredge each chicken breast in the flour, shaking off any excess.

Step 5: Dip the floured chicken in the beaten eggs, ensuring it\'s well-coated.

Step 6: Press the chicken into the breadcrumb and Parmesan mixture, ensuring an even coating. Repeat for all chicken breasts.

Step 7: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.

Step 8: Fry the breaded chicken breasts until golden brown on both sides. This step is to give the chicken a crisp exterior; it doesn\'t need to cook through as it will finish in the oven.

Step 9: In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce.

Step 10: Place the fried chicken breasts in the baking dish.

Step 11: Spoon additional marinara sauce over each chicken breast.

Step 12: Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the top.

Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through, and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Step 14: Garnish with fresh basil or parsley before serving.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1 teaspoon dried oregano
• 1 teaspoon dried basil
• 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 can (10.5 oz) condensed cream of chicken soup
• 1/2 cup chicken broth
• 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
• 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
• 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1/2 cup sour cream
• Fresh parsley for garnish

Step 1: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, dried oregano, dried basil, and dried thyme.

Step 2: Place the seasoned chicken breasts in the slow cooker.

Step 3: In a bowl, mix condensed cream of chicken soup with chicken broth. Pour the mixture over the chicken.

Step 4: Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.

Step 5: About 30 minutes before serving, shred the chicken using two forks.

Step 6: Stir in shredded cheddar cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, and sour cream. Mix well.

Step 7: Cover and continue cooking on low for an additional 20-30 minutes or until the cheeses are melted and the mixture is creamy.

Step 8: Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

Step 9: Slow Cooker Cheesy Chicken can be served over cooked rice, pasta, or with your favorite side dishes.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1 teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
• 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
• 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1 cup milk
• 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
• 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
• Fresh parsley for garnish

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and dried thyme.

Step 3: In an oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Sear the chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown.

Step 5: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 6: While the chicken is baking, prepare the cheese sauce. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.

Step 7: Add flour and whisk continuously to create a roux. Cook for 1-2 minutes until it becomes lightly golden.

Step 8: Gradually pour in the milk, whisking constantly to avoid lumps.

Step 9: Continue cooking and whisking until the sauce thickens.

Step 10: Reduce heat to low, then stir in shredded cheddar cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, and grated Parmesan cheese. Mix until the cheeses are melted and the sauce is smooth.

Step 11: Season the cheese sauce with additional salt and black pepper to taste.

Step 12: Once the chicken is done, spoon the cheese sauce over the chicken breasts.

Step 13: Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup coconut milk
• Zest and juice of 2 limes
• 3 tablespoons soy sauce
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 2 tablespoons coconut oil
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
• Fresh cilantro for garnish
• Lime wedges for serving

Step 1: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: In a bowl, whisk together coconut milk, lime zest, lime juice, soy sauce, and honey. Set aside.

Step 3: In a large skillet, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Sear the chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown.

Step 5: Lower the heat to medium, add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Sauté for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

Step 6: Pour the coconut lime sauce over the chicken in the skillet.

Step 7: Simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

Step 8: Garnish with fresh cilantro.Serve the Coconut Lime Chicken over rice or with your favorite side dish.

Step 9: You can optionally marinate the chicken in a portion of the coconut lime sauce for a few hours before cooking for enhanced flavor.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1/4 cup honey
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 teaspoon fresh ginger, grated
• Sesame seeds and chopped green onions for garnish

Step 1: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: In a bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, and grated ginger to create the glaze. Set aside a portion for later.

Step 3: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Sear the chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown.

Step 5: Pour the honey glaze over the chicken in the skillet, coating each piece evenly.

Step 6: Lower the heat to medium and continue cooking for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the glaze has thickened.

Step 7: Baste the chicken with the glaze occasionally during cooking.

Step 8: Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.

Step 9: Drizzle the reserved honey glaze over the chicken just before serving.

Step 10: Serve the Honey Glazed Chicken with rice or your favorite side dish.

Step 11: You can optionally marinate the chicken in a portion of the honey glaze for a few hours before cooking for enhanced flavor.

Step 2:In a small bowl, whisk together apricot preserves, Dijon mustard, soy sauce, minced garlic, and fresh thyme leaves to create the glaze.Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.

Step 3: Sear the chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown.

Step 4:Pour the apricot glaze over the chicken in the skillet, coating each piece evenly.

• 4-6 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1/4 cup honey
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 teaspoon fresh ginger, grated
• Sesame seeds and chopped green onions for garnish

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Step 2: Pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels and season with salt and black pepper.

Step 5: Sear the chicken thighs, skin side down, until golden brown.

Step 7: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven.

Step 8: Roast for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken thighs are cooked through and the skin is crispy.

Step 9: Baste the chicken with the glaze halfway through cooking.

Step 10: Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces

• 2 cloves garlic, minced

Step 1: Season the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: In a bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and grated ginger.

Step 3: In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry.

Step 4: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.

Step 5: Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through.

Step 6: Pour the honey sesame sauce over the cooked chicken and toss to coat.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced
• 2 tablespoons chili powder
• Juice and zest of 2 limes
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• Fresh cilantro for garnish
• Sliced jalapeños for extra heat (optional)

Step 1: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: In a blender or food processor, combine diced mango, chili powder, lime juice, lime zest, honey, olive oil, and minced garlic. Blend until smooth.

Step 3: Reserve a portion of the mango mixture for later use.

Step 4: Marinate the chicken breasts in the remaining mango mixture for at least 30 minutes, or refrigerate for several hours for enhanced flavor.

Step 5: Preheat the grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat.

Step 6: Grill the chicken breasts for 6-8 minutes per side or until fully cooked, basting with the reserved mango mixture during the last few minutes of grilling.

Step 7: Garnish with fresh cilantro and sliced jalapeños if desired.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup breadcrumbs (preferably seasoned)
• 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
• 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 2 eggs, beaten
• Olive oil or cooking spray for baking

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a baking sheet with olive oil or cooking spray.

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs and grated Parmesan cheese.

Step 4: In another bowl, mix together softened butter, chopped parsley, minced garlic, lemon zest, and lemon juice.

Step 5: Place each chicken breast between plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet to flatten slightly.

Step 6: Spread a generous portion of the garlic butter mixture over each chicken breast.

Step 7: Roll the chicken breasts tightly, sealing the edges, to form a log or cylinder shape.

Step 8: Dip each rolled chicken breast into the beaten eggs, ensuring it\'s fully coated.

Step 9: Roll the egg-coated chicken in the breadcrumb and Parmesan mixture, pressing the breadcrumbs onto the chicken to adhere.

Step 10: Place the coated chicken breasts on the prepared baking sheet.

Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through.

Step 12: Allow the Baked Chicken Kiev to rest for a few minutes before serving.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 large eggs, beaten
• 1 cup breadcrumbs (preferably Italian seasoned)
• 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1 cup marinara sauce
• 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
• 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped
• Olive oil for frying

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: Dredge each chicken breast in flour, shaking off excess.

Step 4: Dip the floured chicken into the beaten eggs, ensuring it\'s fully coated.

Step 5: In a separate bowl, combine breadcrumbs and grated Parmesan cheese.

Step 6: Coat each chicken breast with the breadcrumb mixture, pressing the crumbs onto the chicken to adhere.

Step 7: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Step 8: Fry the breaded chicken breasts until golden brown on both sides and cooked through (about 4-5 minutes per side).

Step 9: Transfer the fried chicken to a baking dish.

Step 10: Spoon marinara sauce over each chicken breast.

Step 11: Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.

Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Step 13: Garnish with chopped fresh basil before serving.

Step 14: Authentic Chicken Parmesan is often served over spaghetti or your favorite pasta.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
• 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 teaspoon lemon zest
• 1 tablespoon lemon juice
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 2 large eggs, beaten
• 1 cup breadcrumbs (preferably fresh)
• Olive oil for frying

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: In a bowl, combine softened butter, chopped parsley, minced garlic, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Mix well to create the garlic herb butter.

Step 4: Lay out a sheet of plastic wrap. Spoon the garlic herb butter onto the plastic wrap and roll it into a log or cylinder shape. Place it in the freezer to firm up.

Step 5: Flatten each chicken breast slightly with a meat mallet.

Step 6: Remove the garlic herb butter log from the freezer and slice it into 4 equal portions.

Step 7: Place one portion of the garlic herb butter in the center of each chicken breast.

Step 8: Fold the sides of the chicken breast over the butter and roll it tightly, sealing the edges to form a log or cylinder shape.

Step 9: Dredge each chicken breast in flour, shaking off excess.

Step 10: Dip the floured chicken into the beaten eggs, ensuring it\'s fully coated.

Step 11: Coat each chicken breast with breadcrumbs, pressing the crumbs onto the chicken to adhere.

Step 12: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Step 13: Fry the breaded chicken until golden brown on all sides (about 2-3 minutes per side).

Step 14: Transfer the fried chicken to a baking dish.

Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 16: Serve the Classic Chicken Kiev with your favorite side dishes.

Step 1: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, ground cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.

Step 3: In a bowl, mix salsa with olive oil and lime juice.

Step 4: Brush both sides of the chicken breasts with the salsa mixture.

Step 5: Place the chicken breasts on the preheated grill.

Step 6: Grill for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has distinct grill marks.

Step 7: During the last few minutes of grilling, baste the chicken with additional salsa mixture.

Step 8: Remove the grilled chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes.

Step 9: Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro.

Step 10: Serve the Grilled Salsa Chicken with additional salsa on the side and your favorite grilled vegetables.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon chili powder
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 cup diced fresh pineapple
• Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
• Lime wedges (for serving)

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, ground cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.

Step 3: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Brown the chicken breasts on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

Step 5: In a bowl, combine pineapple salsa with diced fresh pineapple.

Step 6: In the same skillet, pour in the pineapple salsa mixture and bring it to a simmer.

Step 7: Return the browned chicken breasts to the skillet, coating them in the pineapple salsa.

Step 8: Cover the skillet with a lid or foil and transfer it to the preheated oven.

Step 9: Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 10: Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro.

Step 11: Serve the Pineapple Salsa Chicken over rice or with your favorite side dishes.

Step 12: Squeeze lime wedges over the chicken before serving.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup Mexican salsa (homemade or store-bought)
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon chili powder
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend
• Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
• Lime wedges (for serving)
• Optional toppings: diced tomatoes, sliced jalapeños, sour cream

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, ground cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.

Step 3: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Brown the chicken breasts on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

Step 5: In the same skillet, pour in Mexican salsa and bring it to a simmer.

Step 6: Return the browned chicken breasts to the skillet, coating them in the Mexican salsa.

Step 7: Cover the skillet with a lid or foil and transfer it to the preheated oven.

Step 8: Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 9: In the last 5 minutes of baking, sprinkle shredded Mexican cheese blend over each chicken breast.

Step 10: Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro.

Step 11: Serve the Mexican Salsa Chicken over rice or with your favorite side dishes.

Step 12: Squeeze lime wedges over the chicken before serving.

Step 13: Optional: Top with diced tomatoes, sliced jalapeños, and a dollop of sour cream.

• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup barbecue sauce (homemade or store-bought)
• 1 cup salsa (homemade or store-bought)
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.

Step 4: Brown the chicken breasts on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

Step 6: In the same skillet, pour in the barbecue and salsa mixture. Bring it to a simmer.

Step 7: Return the browned chicken breasts to the skillet, coating them in the BBQ salsa mixture.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup buffalo sauce
• 1 cup salsa (homemade or store-bought)
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
• Blue cheese crumbles (for garnish
• Celery sticks (for serving)

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and smoked paprika.

Step 3: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Brown the chicken breasts on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

Step 5: In a bowl, mix buffalo sauce with salsa.

Step 6: In the same skillet, pour in the buffalo and salsa mixture. Bring it to a simmer.

Step 7: Return the browned chicken breasts to the skillet, coating them in the buffalo salsa.

Step 8: Cover the skillet with a lid or foil and transfer it to the preheated oven.

Step 9: Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 10: Garnish with blue cheese crumbles.

Step 11: Serve the Buffalo Salsa Chicken with celery sticks on the side.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
• 2 large onions, finely chopped
• 3 tomatoes, chopped
• 1/4 cup vegetable oil
• 3 cloves garlic, minced
• 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
• 2 green chilies, finely chopped
• 1 cup coconut milk
• 1/2 cup plain yogurt
• 2 tablespoons curry powder
• 1 tablespoon garam masala
• 1 tablespoon ground coriander
• 1 teaspoon turmeric
• 1 teaspoon cumin
• 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste for desired spice level)
• Salt to taste
• Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
•Cooked basmati rice or naan bread (for serving)

Step 1: In a large pan or pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and cook until they become golden brown.

Step 2: Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.

Step 3: Add curry powder, garam masala, ground coriander, turmeric, cumin, and cayenne pepper. Stir well to coat the onions with the spices.

Step 4: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil starts to separate from the spice mixture.

Step 5: Add the bite-sized chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.

Step 6: Pour in the coconut milk and plain yogurt. Stir to combine.

Step 7: Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let the curry simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.

Step 8: Season with salt to taste.

Step 9: Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Step 10: Serve the Spicy Chicken Curry over cooked basmati rice or with naan bread.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 4 cloves garlic, minced
• Zest and juice of 2 limes
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon chili powder
• 1 teaspoon paprika
• 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste)
• 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
• Lime wedges (for serving)
• Sliced green onions (for garnish)
• Cooked rice or quinoa (for serving)

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: In a bowl, mix minced garlic, lime zest, lime juice, olive oil, ground cumin, chili powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper.

Step 4: Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish.

Step 5: Pour the garlic lime marinade over the chicken, ensuring each piece is well coated.

Step 6: Let the chicken marinate for at least 15 minutes.

Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 8: Sprinkle chopped cilantro over the cooked chicken.

Step 9: Serve the Spicy Garlic Lime Chicken over cooked rice or quinoa.

Step 10: Garnish with lime wedges and sliced green onions.

• 2 lbs (about 1 kg) chicken wings, split at joints, tips discarded
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1/2 cup unsalted butter
• 1/2 cup hot sauce (like Frank's RedHot)
• 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
• Celery sticks and ranch or blue cheese dressing (for serving)

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Step 2: Season the chicken wings with salt and black pepper.

Step 3: In a large bowl, combine flour, garlic powder, and onion powder. Dredge the chicken wings in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.

Step 4: Place a wire rack on a baking sheet. Arrange the coated wings on the rack.

Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until the wings are golden and crispy.

Step 6: While the wings are baking, prepare the buffalo sauce. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.

Step 7: Stir in the hot sauce and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for a few minutes until the sauce is well combined and heated through.

Step 8: Once the wings are done baking, transfer them to a large bowl.

Step 9: Pour the buffalo sauce over the wings and toss until they are evenly coated.

Step 10: Serve the Buffalo Chicken Wings with celery sticks and your choice of ranch or blue cheese dressing.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup orange juice (freshly squeezed or store-bought)
• Zest of 1 orange
• Zest of 1 orange
• 1/4 cup soy sauce
• 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
• 2 tablespoons honey
• 1 tablespoon Sriracha sauce (adjust to taste for desired spice level)
• 1 teaspoon sesame oil
• 2 tablespoons cornstarch
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 4 green onions, sliced
• Sesame seeds (for garnish)
• Cooked white rice (for serving)

Step 1: Season the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: In a bowl, whisk together orange juice, orange zest, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, Sriracha sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch. Ensure the cornstarch is fully dissolved.

Step 3: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Add the seasoned chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.

Step 5: In the same skillet, pour in the orange sauce mixture. Bring it to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens.

Step 6: Return the cooked chicken to the skillet, tossing to coat each piece in the spicy orange sauce.

Step 7: Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

Step 8: Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.

Step 9: Serve the Spicy Orange Chicken over cooked white rice.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into thin strips
• 1 tablespoon soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon fish sauce
• 1 tablespoon curry powder
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
• Wooden skewers, soaked in water for at least 30 minutes
• 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter
• 3 tablespoons soy sauce
• 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
• 1 tablespoon honey
• 1 tablespoon Sriracha sauce (adjust to taste)
• 1 teaspoon sesame oil
• 1 clove garlic, minced
• Water (as needed to thin the sauce)

Step 1: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, fish sauce, curry powder, honey, minced garlic, and vegetable oil. Add the chicken strips and marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Step 2: Preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.

Step 3: Thread the marinated chicken strips onto the soaked wooden skewers.

Step 4: Grill the chicken skewers for 4-5 minutes on each side or until fully cooked and slightly charred.

Step 5: While the chicken is grilling, prepare the spicy peanut sauce. In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, Sriracha sauce, sesame oil, and minced garlic. Add water as needed to achieve your desired consistency.

Step 6: Once the chicken skewers are done, serve them with the spicy peanut sauce on the side for dipping.

Step 7: Garnish with chopped cilantro or crushed peanuts if desired.

Step 8: Enjoy the Spicy Chicken Satay as an appetizer or main course.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 cup cornstarch
• 2 large eggs, beaten
• Vegetable oil for frying
• 1/2 cup hot sauce (like Frank's RedHot)
• 1/2 cup honey
• 1/4 cup soy sauce
• 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
• 1 teaspoon minced garlic
• 1 teaspoon minced ginger
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water (cornstarch slurry)
• Sesame seeds
• Sliced green onions
• Cooked white rice

Step 1: Season the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: Dredge the chicken pieces in cornstarch, then dip them into beaten eggs, coating them evenly.

Step 3: In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Fry the coated chicken pieces in batches until they are golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.

Step 5: In a small saucepan, combine hot sauce, honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and minced ginger. Bring the mixture to a simmer.

Step 6: In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry. Add the slurry to the saucepan and stir until the sauce thickens.

Step 7: Toss the fried chicken pieces in the firecracker sauce until they are fully coated.

Step 8: Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Step 9: Serve the Firecracker Chicken over cooked white rice.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
• 1 large onion, finely chopped
• 3 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
• 2 tablespoons red curry paste
• 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
• 1 teaspoon ground coriander
• 1 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste)
• 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
• 1 cup chicken broth
• 1 tablespoon fish sauce
• 1 tablespoon soy sauce
• 1 tablespoon brown sugar
• Juice of 1 lime
• Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
• Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)

Step 1: Season the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper.

Step 2: In a large skillet or pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened.

Step 3: Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.

Step 4: Stir in red curry paste, ground turmeric, ground coriander, and chili powder. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.

Step 5: Add the chicken pieces to the skillet, cooking until browned on all sides.

Step 6: Pour in coconut milk, chicken broth, fish sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar. Stir to combine.

Step 7: Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 8: Just before serving, squeeze lime juice into the curry and stir.

Step 9: Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Step 10: Serve the Spicy Coconut Chicken Curry over cooked jasmine rice.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice
• 2 teaspoons chili powder
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon paprika
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon onion powder
• 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste)
• Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
• Lime wedges

Step 1: In a bowl, combine olive oil, fresh lime juice, chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.

Step 2: Season the thinly sliced chicken breasts with the prepared marinade. Ensure the chicken is well-coated. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Step 3: Heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Grill the marinated chicken slices for 3-4 minutes per side or until fully cooked and grill marks appear.

Step 5: Grill the marinated chicken slices for 3-4 minutes per side or until fully cooked and grill marks appear.

Step 6: Serve the Chili Lime Chicken with lime wedges on the side.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs
• 2 tablespoons harissa paste
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 teaspoon ground cumin
• 1 teaspoon ground coriander
• 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon honey
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• Fresh cilantro, chopped
• Lemon wedges

Step 1: In a bowl, combine harissa paste, olive oil, ground cumin, ground coriander, smoked paprika, garlic powder, honey, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to form the harissa marinade.

Step 2: Pat the chicken thighs dry and place them in a resealable plastic bag or shallow dish.

Step 3: Pour the harissa marinade over the chicken, ensuring each piece is well-coated. Seal the bag or cover the dish and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight.

Step 4: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Step 5: Remove the marinated chicken from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.

Step 6: Transfer the chicken to a baking dish.

Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and has a nice char.

Step 8: Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with lemon wedges on the side.

• 1.5 lbs (680g) chicken drumsticks and thighs
• 3 tablespoons olive oil
• 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 tablespoon smoked paprika
• 1 tablespoon sweet paprika
• 1 teaspoon dried oregano
• 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste)
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• Fresh parsley, chopped
• Lemon wedges

Step 1: In a bowl, combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, smoked paprika, sweet paprika, dried oregano, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to create the peri-peri marinade.

Step 2: Pat the chicken pieces dry and place them in a resealable plastic bag or shallow dish.

Step 3: Pour the peri-peri marinade over the chicken, ensuring each piece is well-coated. Seal the bag or cover the dish and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight.

Step 4: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.

Step 5: Remove the marinated chicken from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.

Step 6: Grill the chicken pieces for 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally, or until the chicken is fully cooked and has a nice char.

Step 7: Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve with lemon wedges on the side.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 1 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1 teaspoon paprika
• 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
• 1 bunch asparagus spears, trimmed
• 1 tablespoon olive oil
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• Zest of 1 lemon
• Zest of 1 lemon
• Salt and black pepper to taste
• 1/2 cup heavy cream
• 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
• Salt and black pepper to taste

Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Season each chicken breast with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, and dried thyme.

Step 3: Lay the chicken breasts flat and make a horizontal cut through the center to create a pocket for the filling.

Step 4: Toss asparagus spears with olive oil, minced garlic, lemon zest, salt, and black pepper.

Step 5: Stuff each chicken breast with the seasoned asparagus spears.

Step 6: Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.

Step 7: Sear the stuffed chicken breasts for 2-3 minutes on each side until they develop a golden-brown crust.

Step 8: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Step 9: In a small saucepan, heat heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper over low heat. Stir until the sauce is smooth and warmed through.

Step 10: Drizzle the creamy Parmesan sauce over the stuffed chicken breasts before serving.

Step 11: Garnish with additional fresh thyme or chopped parsley if desired.
